title: Firefox and FancyZones in Windows 11
content:
Chrome seamlessly harmonizes with the PowerToys FancyZones feature in Windows 11. In Chrome, I can drag a tab out of a browser window, and instantly snap it into a FancyZone. I can also quickly arrange multiple separate Chrome windows into FancyZones without issue.

Firefox's interaction with FancyZones is not good. When I drag a tab out of a window, it doesn't allow me to snap it into a FancyZone. I first need to release left click, allowing the tab's new window to appear, then I can snap that window into a FancyZone.

The biggest occurs when I have multiple Firefox windows open and snap one of them into a FancyZone. Often, one of the open Firefox windows will spontaneously shrink itself in size. When I try to manually resize the window back to normal, it shrinks further and further, until it is an invisible sliver. The only solution when this occurs is to fully restart Firefox.

It seems strange that Firefox has such poor compatibility with FancyZones, which is growing in popularity along with other productivity tools in PowerToys. Wondering if anyone else has experienced these issues, if there is any workaround, or if there is a fix being worked on.
creator: bjgrenke

When I go to the MyDlink website using Firefox Version 128.5.2 ESR I get this message:

title: Server Not Found issues
content:
Hey all. I am having some connection issues with my secondary comp. Firefox 132.0.2

I recently moved and am getting my home office set back up. Nothing was changed during the move other than shutting down, unhooking everything and setting it back up at the new home. My secondary comp is used for live streaming various TV channels, Youtube, live radio broadcasts etc. Youtube, Google and Gmail loads and works fine. Several of the TV channels load the page but will not stream. Rumble, the two radio stations I listen to and our website host access page all give me the Server Not Found screen. It also fails to update Firefox. Also, my Thunderbird will not download new emails. Now here is the weird part. I can go to all of these sites on my main comp and everything loads and works fine. Any ideas? I have tried changing different settings but nothing makes any difference. I even disabled the firewall.

Thanks.

title: B3 Bomber Leather Jackets A Classic Look That Never Goes¬†Out¬†of¬†Style
content:
When it comes to style, some gadgets stand the check of time, and the bomber jacket B3 bomber leather-based jacket is a prime example of tolerating fashion and undying enchantment. In an international wherein developments come and move, this traditional piece has maintained its reputation and relevance for many years.

A Rich History: 

    The B3 bomber leather-based jacket has a storied history that dates back to World War II. Originally designed to keep aviators warm in the cold of high altitudes, this jacket was as practical as it changed into stylish. Its rugged proper looks and the exceptional warm temperature quickly made it a favorite amongst pilots.

Iconic Design: 

     The B3 bomber leather jacket's design is unmistakable. It typically features an opulent shearling collar, leather-based outside, and a snug match. This aggregate of functions has made it an iconic piece that exudes masculinity and confidence.

Versatile Wardrobe Staple: 

    What sets the B3 bomber leather-based jacket apart from many different fashion objects is its versatility. It seamlessly integrates into numerous patterns, from a rugged, informal look to an extra polished and dressy outfit. It may be worn with denim, chinos, or maybe over a fit, making it a cloth wardrobe staple that adapts to specific events.

Sustainability and Durability: 

    In a generation of rapid fashion, investing in a B3 bomber leather jacket isn't always only a style announcement but also a sustainable choice. These jackets are constructed to the ultimate, and their sturdiness way they won't become in landfills as speedy as many different clothes.

Timeless Appeal: 

    The B3 bomber leather jacket remains a symbol of rebellion, adventure, and individuality. Whether you're a vintage enthusiast or a fashion-forward trendsetter, this jacket's attraction endures for a long time.

In conclusion, 

    the B3 bomber leather jacket is more than just a chunk of apparel; it is an image of timeless fashion and individuality. Its rich records, iconic layout, versatility, sustainability, and enduring enchantment make it a traditional look that never goes out of favor. So, if you're seeking to invest in a fashion object so that it will stand the take a look at of time, the B3 bomber leather-based jacket is a worthy desire.

title: No left right or up down tab navigation, other than alt 1-9.
content:
Issue 1: As with vimium(https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/vimium/dbepggeogbaibhgnhhndojpepiihcmeb?hl=en&pli=1) extension we can press J or K to more left or right, or in Zen browser's case, up and down. But vimium has limitation as it doesn't run on Zen's native web points like settings homepage etc. Please add a shortcut for navigation between tabs other than alt 1-9. Where we can just change adjacent tabs.

Issue 2: Also on full screen the bookmark bar it impossible to access with shortcut or without it just vanishes

Issue3: The browser close minimize icon are just useless on full screen I3WM or HyprLand like windows manager as we never need to do those things.

Issues are arranged in their priority order, as the top one needs the most focus from the devs.

title: Tabs Switching
content:
Hello,

I have an issue where, when I switch tabs with Ctrl+Tab, my mouse cursor accidentally triggers something if it happens to be in the center. This is very annoying. I tried Googling how to turn off tab visualization through the config, but it hasn't worked so far. 

   * browser.ctrlTab.previews
  • browser.tabs.closeWindowWithLastTab
  • browser.tabs.animate
  • toolkit.cosmeticAnimations.enabled

So now, the only option I see is to turn off Recent Tabs, but then the browser becomes unusable. I also tried the same on a new clean user profile and even on new Mozilla-based browsers, but still nothing. It would be ideal to make the cursor inactive while switching tabs, like it is in Arc Browser and probably many others. But I would be happy enough to just turn off tab switching visualization.
